questions.question: We ...................................... for them.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that is going on at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: I ...................................... for London tomorrow.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: I ...................................... meeting him at the party.
questions.description: The verb remember is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: He ........................................ to a local football club.
questions.description: The word belong is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: She .......................................... many books.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about finished past events when we do not mention exactly when those actions took place.

questions.question: Somebody ...................................... the gate unlocked.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about finished past events whose effect is still felt in the present.

questions.question: I ..................................... them for a long time.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about an action that began sometime in the past and is still continuing.

questions.question: He ....................................... me several times.
questions.description: We can use the present perfect tense to talk about a past action when it is not mentioned when the action took place.

questions.question: He ............................................... the violin for two years.
questions.description: We use the present perfect continuous to talk about an action that started in the past and has continued up to the present.
